MyArm
GITEICaptoglove.​Module
public
GITEICaptoglove.​MyArm

Handles Captoglove module configured as forearm sensor.

Author
Laura Moreno

laamo[xxx]renoro@unal.[xxx]edu.co

Copyrigth

Copyrigth 2020 Universidad Nacional de Colombia, all rigths reserved.

Types
ArmType
public enum ArmType

List of possible ways to use Captoglove module with this class:

TYPE_RIGHT_FOREARM

As right forearm sensor

TYPE_LEFT_FOREARM

As left forearm sensor

Functions
MyArm
public MyArm(
int nID,
ArmType eType
)

Initializes variables for Captoglove module configuration.

Parameters
nID
int

Captoglove ID (4 digits number)

etype
ArmType

Captoglove use mode

Example
MyArm RightArm = new MyArm(2469, MyArm.ArmType.TYPE_RIGHT_FOREARM);
SetArmType
private void SetArmType(
ArmType eType
)

Saves Captoglove module use mode.

Parameters
eType
ArmType

Captoglove module use mode

Example
SetArmType(MyArm.ArmType.TYPE_RIGHT_FOREARM);
GetArmType
public ArmType GetArmType()
Returns

Captoglove module use mode

SetArmObject
public int SetArmObject(
Transform tArmObj
)

Attaches Captoglove module movement to arm object.

Parameters
tArmObj
Transform

Forearm object

Returns
0

Success

-1

Object error

Example
SetArmObject(transRA);
Notes

Place the arm object horizontally in the scene before assigning it in this function to save default position.

SetInitialRot
public void SetInitialRot(
float fRotX,
float fRotY,
float fRotZ
)

Saves initial rotation for arm object.

Parameters
fRotX
float

Object x rotation

fRotY
float

Object y rotation

fRotZ
float

Object z rotation

Example
SetInitialRot(0, 90, -90);
Notes

Use this function to manually set the initial rotation of arm object in case SetArmObject() is saving wrong values by default.  Use this function after SetArmObject().

SetDefaultRotLimits
private void SetDefaultRotLimits()

Set the limits for the rotation of the arm object.

Notes

The values configured in this function are valid only for the arm 3D model provided with this library.

SetPitchLimits
private void SetPitchLimits(
float fMaxUpRotation,
float fMaxDownRotation
)

Creates the algorithm for pitch rotation of the arm.

Parameters
fMaxUpRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the arm is pointing upward in the pitch movement

fMaxDownRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the arm is pointing downward in the pitch movement

Example
SetPitchLimits(90, -90);
Notes

Values must be set as they are read in Unity Inspector panel for arm object.

SetYawLimits
private void SetYawLimits(
float fMaxRightRotation,
float fMaxLeftRotation
)

Creates the algorithm for yaw rotation of the arm.

Parameters
fMaxRightRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the arm is pointing to the right in the yaw movement

fMaxLeftRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the arm is pointing to the left in the yaw movement

Example
SetYawLimits(90, -90);
Notes

Values must be set as they are read in Unity Inspector panel for arm object.

MoveArm
public void MoveArm()

Updates arm object rotation according with Captoglove module movement.

Notes

Call this function in the Update() function of Unity script to simulate arm movement.

SetArmAngle
private void SetArmAngle()

Calculates arm object rotation according with Captoglove module quaternion rotation.

Angle2Axes
private void Angle2Axes(
float fPitchA,
float fYawA,
float fRollA
)

Set rotation angle to each axis of the arm object.

Parameters
fPitchA
float

Angle of pitch rotation

fYawA
float

Angle of yaw rotation

fRollA
float

Angle of roll rotation

GetArmPosition
public Vector3 GetArmPosition()
Returns

Global position of arm object

GetArmRotation
public Vector3 GetArmRotation()
Returns

Global euler angles of arm object

SaveInFile
public void SaveInFile(
string sFileName
)

Saves module data in file with following format: x arm rotation; y arm rotation; z arm rotation  [quaternions]

Parameters
sFileName
string

File name

Example
SaveInFile("RightArmMov.csv");
Notes

Call this function in Updated() function of Unity script to save data continuously
